dt: {bc}a female offspring especially of human parents

dt.t: the United States is a {wi}daughter{/wi} of Great Britain

dt: {bc}an atomic species {dx_def}see {dxt|species:1||1e}{/dx_def} that is the product of the radioactive decay {dx_def}see {dxt|decay:2||5a}{/dx_def} of a given element

et: Middle English, {it}doughter{/it}, from Old English {it}dohtor{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}tohter{/it} daughter, Greek {it}thygatēr{/it}
shortdef: a female offspring especially of human parents

dt: {bc}having the characteristics or relationship of a daughter {dx_def}see {dxt|daughter:1||1}{/dx_def}
{bc}belonging to the first generation of offspring, {d_link|organelles|organelle}, or molecules produced by reproduction, division, or replication

shortdef: having the characteristics or relationship of a daughter
belonging to the first generation of offspring, organelles, or molecules produced by reproduction, division, or replication

dt: {bc}the wife of one's son or daughter

shortdef: the wife of one's son or daughter

dt: {bc}a son/daughter who leaves his or her parents to do things that they do not approve of but then feels sorry and returns home

dt.t: He left the company several years ago, but now the {it}prodigal son{/it} has returned.

shortdef: a son/daughter who leaves his or her parents to do things that they do not approve of but then feels sorry and returns home —often used figuratively
